description: This trap should be sent whenever the one way jitter
on a CFM test will surpass one of the 2 defined thresholds.

event.Summary: One way jitter surpassed threshold on CFM

description: One way jitter calculated for
a specific remote MEP in milliseconds
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultOneWayJitter

description: Specifies one-way jitter warning values
to monitor in milliseconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfile1wJitterWarning

description: Specifies one-way jitter error values
to monitor in milliseconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfile1wJitterError

description: This trap should be sent whenever the two way jitter
on a CFM test will surpass one of the 2 defined thresholds.

event.Summary: Two way jitter surpassed threshold on CFM

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmJitterThreshold PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultTwoWayJitter u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterWarning u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterWarningPeriod u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterError u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterErrorPeriod u 9999

description: Two way jitter calculated for a specific
remote MEP in milliseconds
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultTwoWayJitter

description: Specifies round-trip jitter warning values
to monitor in milliseconds. If set value is greater than the
jitter-error it means that the warning is disabled.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterWarning

description: Specifies the duration jitter occurs in seconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterWarningPeriod

description: Specifies round-trip jitter error values
to monitor in milliseconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterError

description: Specifies the duration jitter occurs in seconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileJitterErrorPeriod

description: This trap should be sent whenever the frame loss
on a CFM test will surpass one of the 2 defined
thresholds.

event.Summary: Frame loss surpassed threshold on CFM

description: Two way frameloss calculated for a specific
remote MEP in units of hundredths of percent.
Note: When prvtCfmProcessResultFrameloss has
value of 10000, all the values of
prvtCfmProcessResultOneWayJitter
prvtCfmProcessResultTwoWayJitter and
prvtCfmProcessResultLatency are irrelevant.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultFrameloss

description: Specifies round-trip frame-loss warning
values to monitor. The default is frame-loss
of 8% is reported. If set value is greater
than the frame-loss-error it means
that the warning is disable.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileFrameLossWarning

description: Specifies round-trip frame-loss error
values to monitor. The default is
frame-loss of 10% is reported.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileFrameLossError

description: This trap should be sent whenever the latency
on a CFM test will surpass one of the 2 defined
thresholds.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmLatencyThreshold PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultLatency u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyWarning u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyWarningPeriod u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyError u 9999 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyErrorPeriod u 9999

description: Two way latency calculated for a specific
remote MEP in milliseconds
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProcessResultLatency

description: Specifies round-trip latency error
values to monitor in milliseconds.
If set value is greater than the
latency-error it means that the
warning is disabled.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyWarning

description: Specifies the duration latency increase occurs.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyWarningPeriod

description: Specifies round-trip latency error values
to monitor in milliseconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyError

description: Specifies the duration latency increase
occurs in seconds.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmProfileLatencyErrorPeriod

description: References to in the [G.8021/Y.1341] :
Unexpected Priority defect (dUNPr)
The Unexpected Priority defect is calculated at the ETH layer.
It detects the configuration of different Priorities
for CCM at different MEPs belonging to the same MEG.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmUnexpectedPriority PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDirection i 1 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDbMacAddress s EXAMPL PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepInterfaceIndex i 9999

description: The direction in which the MEP faces on the Bridge port.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDirection

description: The MAC address of the remote MEP.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDbMacAddress

description: This object is the interface index (from ifTable) of either
a bridge port, or an aggregated IEEE 802.1 link
to which the MEP is attached.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepInterfaceIndex

description: A MEP has a persistent defect condition. A notification
(fault alarm) is sent to the management entity with the OID
of the MEP that has detected the fault.
Whenever a MEP has a persistent defect
it may or may not generate a Fault Alarm to warn the system
administrator of the problem, as controlled by the MEP
Fault Notification Generator State Machine and associated
Managed Objects. Only the highest-priority defect, as shown
in Table 20-1, is reported in the Fault Alarm.
If a defect with a higher priority is raised after a Fault
Alarm has been issued, another Fault Alarm is issued.
The management entity receiving the notification can identify
the system from the network source address of the
notification, and can identify the MEP reporting the defect
by the indices in the OID of the prvtCfmMepHighestPrDefect
variable in the notification:
prvtCfmMdName - Also the index of the MEP's
Maintenance Domain table entry
(prvtCfmMdTable).
prvtCfmMaName - Also an index (with the MD table index)
of the MEP's Maintenance Association
table entry
(prvtCfmMaTable)
prvtCfmMepIdentifier - MEP Identifier and final index
into the MEP table (prvtCfmMepTable).
REFERENCE
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmFaultAlarm PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDirection i 1 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepHighestPrDefect i 0 PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepInterfaceIndex i 9999

description: The direction in which the MEP faces on the Bridge port.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDirection

description: The highest priority defect that has been present since the
MEPs Fault Notification Generator State Machine was last in
the FNG_RESET state.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepHighestPrDefect

description: This object is the interface index (from ifTable) of either
a bridge port, or an aggregated IEEE 802.1 link
to which the MEP is attached.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepInterfaceIndex

description: A MEP may generate a AIS/LCK notification each time its
AIS/LCK condition is activated.
REFERENCE
ITU-T Recommendation Y.1731 APPENDIX I Defect Conditions
I.7 AIS Condition, I.9 LCK Condition
AIS condition
Is true by detection of signal
fail condition at a Server layer or reception of AIS at a
server (sub-) layer MEP [AIS condition/Rec. ITU-T Y.1731]
Respectively AIS condition Exit criteria:
'During an interval equal to 3.5 times the AIS transmission
period indicated in the AIS frames received earlier
the MEP does not receive AIS frames or
when ETH-CC is used, upon clearing of LOC defect at
MEP' /Appendix I/Rec. ITU-T Y.1731
If prvtCfmMaAisLckLevel is configured the MEP should send AIS packets
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepAisCondition

description: The notification is sent each time
AIS/LCK condition is cleared.
REFERENCE
ITU-T Recommendation Y.1731 APPENDIX I Defect Conditions
I.7 AIS Condition, I.9 LCK Condition
AIS condition
Is true by detection of signal
fail condition at a Server layer or reception of AIS at a
server (sub-) layer MEP [AIS condition/Rec. ITU-T Y.1731]
Respectively AIS condition Exit criteria:
'During an interval equal to 3.5 times the AIS transmission
period indicated in the AIS frames received earlier
the MEP does not receive AIS frames or
when ETH-CC is used, upon clearing of LOC defect at
MEP' /Appendix I/Rec. ITU-T Y.1731
If prvtCfmMaAisLckLevel is configured the MEP should send AIS packets
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepAisCondition

description: A MEP's persistent defect condition has cleared. A notification
is sent to the management entity with the OID
of the MEP that has cleared the fault.
The management entity receiving the notification can identify
the system from the network source address of the
notification, and can identify the MEP by the indices in the
OID of the prvtCfmMepIdentifier variable in the notification:
prvtCfmMdName - Also the index of the MEP's
Maintenance Domain table entry
(prvtCfmMdTable).
prvtCfmMaName - Also an index (with the MD table index)
of the MEP's Maintenance Association
table entry
(prvtCfmMaTable)
prvtCfmMepIdentifier - MEP Identifier and final index
into the MEP table (prvtCfmMepTable).
The direction in which the MEP faces on the Bridge port.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepDirection

description: Current state of the MEP Fault Notification Generator
State Machine.
variables.name: PRVT-CFM-MIB::prvtCfmMepFngState
